title: ICE when `yield` is used as an argument to `println!`

labels.name: E-easy
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Easy / not much (good first issue)

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-mentor
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue has a mentor. Use RustcContributor::new on Zulip for discussion.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-help-wanted
labels.description: Call for participation: Help is requested to fix this issue.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
Hi,

```rust
#![feature(generator_trait)]
#![feature(generators)]

use std::ops::Generator;

fn gen() -> impl Generator<usize> {
    |_: usize| {
        println!("-> {}", yield);
    }
}
```
[playground link](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=55e65a869e1f5fef64cc4462b1a5a087)

ICEs, on today's nightly, with:
```
error: internal compiler error: src/librustc_mir/transform/promote_consts.rs:467: _1 = suspend(move _21) -> [resume: bb2, drop: bb3] not promotable
 --> src/lib.rs:8:27
  |
8 |         println!("-> {}", yield);
  |                           ^^^^^
```
